alert.note: Alert for Dickinson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 10:29AM CDT until July 16 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Little Sioux River near Milford affecting Dickinson County. Little Sioux River above Spencer / Highway 18 affecting Clay County. Little Sioux River near Montgomery affecting Dickinson County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Sioux River near Milford. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, the bridge on 190th Avenue near 240th Street is overtopped, and 180th Street between 170th Avenue and 190th Avenue is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Monday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 PM CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Little Sioux River Milford 12.0 14.8 Mon 9 AM 15.0 14.4 13.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.
